intro: Diplogenea, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plants are typically shrubs or small trees, native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They have palmate leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Diplogenea species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are adapted to well-drained soils.
